sub_topic: Finding the volume of a sphere inscribed in a cube.
message_1: A cube has a side length of 6 cm. Find the volume of the largest sphere that can fit inside the cube.
message_2:
The largest sphere that can fit inside a cube will have a diameter equal to the side length of the cube. In this case, the diameter of the sphere is 6 cm. The radius of the sphere will be half of the diameter, which is 3 cm.

The volume of a sphere can be calculated using the formula:

V = (4/3)πr^3

where V is the volume, r is the radius, and π (pi) is a mathematical constant approximately equal to 3.14159.

Substituting the given radius into the formula:

V = (4/3)π(3)^3
V = (4/3)π(27)
V = (4)(3.14159)(9)
V ≈ 113.097 cubic centimeters

The volume of the largest sphere that can fit inside the cube is approximately 113.097 cubic centimeters.
